name: torturously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves a lot of suffering or difficulty: I began to understand how torturously painful life has been for him all these years. With a huge effort she placed one foot torturously after another.
More examplesFewer examplesSitting through the play was a torturously unpleasant and pointless experience.The restoration work on the cathedral is torturously painstaking.I would love to visit more often, but I am put off by the torturously long flight.European bureaucracy can be torturously slow.
